lexUnit.name: flare.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: burn, shine, or be revealed with a sudden intensity.

sentence.text: Ben 's eyes flared , but went cold as he told himself -- Harriet presumed -- ` I must n't hurt anyone .
He was n't sure he had been so keen simply because as an Opposition backbencher he was flattered to be in demand , or simply because his eyes flared and his knees tingled every time he saw her .
Stephen 's eyes flared angrily .
Her blue eyes flared fiercely .
Her eyes flared with shock and resentment .
Her eyes flared at the stinging insult , only too aware that he outstripped her professionally .
Dot saw how the gold patterns on the cover caught the flicker from the fire and flared like Very lights .
Fincara cried , and light flared over them the woman 's laughing face , and Adam 's burning blindness .
A light flared briefly at the side of the furthest cart , and then a torch flew through the air over the target .
The orange light flared and he jabbed at it .
A vivid light flared outside , bright enough to penetrate the heavy curtains .
Beyond the doorway the dim light flared suddenly , illuminating the fleeing rats with an unearthly orange glow .
Now the horizon was brighter , with little curling lights flaring into the glow .
There suddenly seemed to be nothing between them except the hatred flaring in Ursula 's eyes .
` I think you are acquiring the Samhailt , Raynor , " she said , and saw sudden delight flare in his eyes .
Fury flared in her eyes .
Athelstan saw the hope flare in the young man 's eyes .
` I am sure that was so , " Corbett replied drily , regretting the quip as soon as it was uttered , noticing the hostility flare in the Prince 's light blue eyes .
A tiny spark flared in her eyes .
A brief hardness flared in his eyes .
The trunks of the gum trees soared bright pink , the tack room windows flared crimson and all the birds in the world seemed to be singing for joy .
For an instant , the plate glass all around them flared blue-white , the building shook as the pain of a Darkfall strike stabbed into their ears again .
Somewhere beyond , on the forecourt perhaps , orange flame seemed to splutter and flare in the darkness .
No , not expressive any more , Guy acknowledged , as the candle flared briefly in a gust of air from the open window .
Just when his eyes were adjusting to the gloom , the novice ahead of him threw open a door , and Gabriel emerged into pale but blinding sunlight flaring in low through the window of the gallery .
The spaghetti sizzled in the saucepan , the toast flared beneath the grill .
Victor 's face as the match flares in front of it has the rapt attention of a man lighting a fuse .
Later a storm breaks over the hotel ; lightning flares above the mountains across the loch , and the windows rattle as the thunder booms .
There was great excitement in February 1987 , when a supernova flared up in the Large Cloud and became an easy naked-eye object .
